text:
what does the -c flag do in conda install

In the context of the `conda install` command, the `-c` flag is used to specify a channel from which to install packages. Channels are locations where packages are stored. They can be repositories on Anaconda.org or other locations.

For example, if you want to install a package from the `conda-forge` channel, you would use the following command:

```bash
conda install -c conda-forge package_name
```

Here, `-c conda-forge` tells `conda` to look in the `conda-forge` channel for the package named `package_name`.

Channels can be very useful for accessing packages that are not available in the default Anaconda repository or for getting different versions of packages.
conda install bioconda::centrifuge
summary: Using the -c Flag in Conda Install Command
